before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"8m0pt","text":"Filtration and preservation of the water samples through filters","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":64}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4l2mm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8uh3g","text":"As eRNA degrades very rapidly, the water samples must be filtered and preserved very quickly after sampling (less than one hour if possible). If filtration is carried out in the field, the filters should be immediately frozen in liquid nitrogen and then stored at -80°C until the eRNA is extracted. If filtration is carried out in the laboratory, the filters can be stored at -80°C immediately after filtration and until the eRNA is extracted.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":107}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7kg2t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fa2r2","text":"Note:
